DataElement.preferredName: Neurology Self-Reported Epilepsy Assessment Description Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A brain disorder characterized by episodes of abnormally increased neuronal discharge resulting in transient episodes of sensory or motor neurological dysfunction, or psychic dysfunction. These episodes may or may not be associated with loss of consciousness or convulsions._A branch of medicine concerned with the development, anatomy, function, and dysfunction of the nervous system._An individual's perspective or subjective interpretation of an event or information._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something._The words of something written.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: the branch of medical science that deals with the study of structure, function, and diseases of the nervous system; for thorough searching also see NEUROSCIENCE, MENTAL DISORDER, NERVOUS SYSTEM DISORDER, NERVOUS SYSTEM DISORDER DIAGNOSIS, MENTAL DISORDER DIAGNOSIS, NERVOUS SYSTEM DISORDER CHEMOTHERAPY, COMMUNICATION DISORDER, NEUROMUSCULAR DISORDER.

ReferenceDocuments.name: A questionnaire to assess epi
ReferenceDocuments.description: A questionnaire to assess epilepsy, a condition characterized by recurrent seizures and is a component of over 40 neurological disorders which are characterized by recurrent unprovoked seizures
